intro: Benzoin akoense, commonly known as the Akoense benzoin, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae, which includes frankincense and myrrh trees. The plant is characterized by its aromatic resin, which is exuded from the bark and is used in traditional medicine and incense. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive elliptical shape. The tree can grow up to 15 meters tall and thrives in humid, tropical climates with well-drained soil.
